cab.content: THIS DQCtflL-NT IS THlT^PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVEbMMt^SECRET.G.T.5997, V/AR CABINET.RESTITUTION OF HELIGOLAND TO GREAT BRITAIN.Resolution passed at Mooting of Exeoutivo Committee of theNavyiLeague.THE NAVY LEAGUE,13 Victoria Street, S.W.1. 3rd October, 1918,Sir,I have tho honour to inform you that at a meeting of the Executive Committee of the Navy League held at 13 Victoria Street this morning, the following Resolution -Proposed by Commander, Sir Edward Nicholl, R.N.R.Seconded by Admiral, The Honourable Sir E.R. Froomantlc, G.C.B., CM.G,, v/as-'unanimously carried:-"That it is the opinion of the Executive Committoe of the Navy League that, in any terms of peace, tho restitution of Heligoland to Great Britain must be an integral article of the Maritime Settle-ment With Germany,"I have &e.(Sgd.) V.Biscoe Tritton.Joint Chairman.The Right HonourableA.J. Balfour, O.M., LL.D., M.P., Foreign Office, S.W.1, .TV":
